versionA.text:
This is the last part, congrats! In this question, each of you need to provide parts of the answer to fulfill a shared goal. The correctness of the final answer is determined by both of your inputs. 
 
 Based on the information of question 1: 
 
 Twenty-two stroke patients performed a maze task. The mean number of trials for success was 14.7 with s = 6.2, the population mean (μ) for this task is 6.5. 
 
 You and your partner each need to change one value of either s or number of patients so that the new calculated t is half of the original value. 
 
 You are responsible to change the value of s=6.2 within the range of (4-8).

versionB.text:
This is the last part, congrats! In this question, each of you need to provide parts of the answer to fulfill a shared goal. The correctness of the final answer is determined by both of your inputs. 
 
 Based on the information of question 1: 
 
 Twenty-two stroke patients performed a maze task. The mean number of trials for success was 14.7 with s = 6.2, the population mean (μ) for this task is 6.5. 
 
 You and your partner each need to change one value of either s or number of patients so that the new calculated t is half of the original value. 
 
 You are responsible to change the value of the number of patients within the range of (10-50).
